page.title: 09Health
page.content: The people in this area are of stocky build, but very heathy and strong. There is no doctor's surgery in the village, so patients have to register with either the doctor in Gatehouse, to the West, or Kirkcudbright, to the North-East. However, in emergencies, doctors perform home visits. The District Nurse performs home visits to new born babies, which are normally born in Dumfries, 35 miles away, and periodically up to school age. When at school the children are examined during their first year, and sight and hearing are tested bi-annually until they leave at 12. The school dentist visits to inspect all children once a year. If there are enough children needing treatment then he returns with his mobile caravan.Otherwise the children are taken to the next village where the caravan is parked.
